images.caption: Figure 1:Spatiotemporal evolution of collective states across four Couzin model scenarios. Rows correspond to distinct behavioral regimes: Swarm (a–c), Torus (d–f), Dynamic Parallel (g–i), and Highly Parallel (j–l). Columns represent temporal snapshots at initial (t=0t=0), middle (t=T/2t=T/2), and final (t=Tt=T) simulation times. Three-dimensional quiver plots display fish positions with velocity vectors; instantaneous polarizationPPand rotationMMvalues are annotated for each panel. The Swarm configuration maintains disordered aggregation throughout, while the Torus case transitions from initial milling (M=0.95M=0.95) toward partial alignment. Both Dynamic Parallel and Highly Parallel cases exhibit rapid ordering from random initial conditions to coherent directed motion (P>0.98P>0.98).

Figure 2:Temporal evolution of classical order parameters for all four scenarios. Each panel displays polarizationPP(solid lines) and rotationMM(dashed lines) as functions of time, with horizontal dotted lines indicating equilibrium mean values computed over the second half of each simulation. Panel annotations report final values. (a) Swarm: both parameters fluctuate near zero with no sustained ordering. (b) Torus: initial high rotation decays while polarization grows, indicating transition from milling toward partial alignment. (c) Dynamic Parallel: rapid convergence toP≈0.98P\approx 0.98withint≈30t\approx 30time units. (d) Highly Parallel: fastest convergence to near-unity polarization (P=0.998P=0.998) with minimal fluctuations (σP=0.0003\sigma_{P}=0.0003).

Figure 3:Temporal evolution of oceanic entropy metrics across all scenarios. (a) School cohesion entropyHcohH_{\mathrm{coh}}based on nearest-neighbor distance distributions. (b) Polarization entropyHpolH_{\mathrm{pol}}quantifying velocity orientation spread on the unit sphere. (c) Velocity correlation entropyHvelH_{\mathrm{vel}}characterizing pairwise alignment distributions. (d) OSI, a weighted composite of all seven entropy metrics. Lower values indicate more ordered states. The Highly Parallel case achieves the lowest final OSI (0.24), while Swarm maintains elevated disorder (OSI≈0.71\approx 0.71) throughout.

Figure 4:Final state comparison of all metrics across scenarios. (a) Primary entropy metrics: school cohesion (HcohH_{\mathrm{coh}}), polarization (HpolH_{\mathrm{pol}}), and velocity correlation (HvelH_{\mathrm{vel}}). (b) Secondary entropy metrics: depth stratification (HdepthH_{\mathrm{depth}}), angular momentum (HangH_{\mathrm{ang}}), nearest-neighbor variability (HNNH_{\mathrm{NN}}), and school shape (HshapeH_{\mathrm{shape}}). (c) Composite indices: OSI and OI. (d) Classical order parameters: polarization (PP) and rotation (MM). The entropy metrics collectively distinguish all four phases, with OSI providing monotonic ranking from ordered (Highly Parallel, OSI=0.24=0.24) to disordered (Swarm, OSI=0.71=0.71).
